Text.Value: I'd like to see the Hammer, please.
You do know how Raphael likes to play.

EditorData.NodeContext: apologetic and with a slight grin

Text.Value: The moment you step outside this room, all hells will break loose.

EditorData.NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

Text.Value: No. I think the Hammer shall stay exactly where it is.

EditorData.NodeContext: made up his mind. matter of fact

Text.Value: Yes. Nasty little gadfly. I'd swat her if the master wasn't so fond of tormenting her.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated

Text.Value: Ha ha. Ha ha ha! A ho-ho-hopeless situation. Ha ha ha ha ha!

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to stifle laughter at first, then making the intentional 'ho ho ho' into hopeless joke before laughing manically and uncontrollably

Text.Value: Excellent! You can admire it with your eyes, from a distance.

EditorData.NodeContext: faux-delight on the first word. Then sarcastic as he shooes the player away

Text.Value: I commend you! Thinking is a marvellous pastime.

EditorData.NodeContext: faux-encouragement. Very sarcastic

Text.Value: I think I can use the Hammer to save the world.
It is exquisite. The master cast it himself, you know, using metals gathered from the depths of the Hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

Text.Value: The resident favours their favourites. Satisfy them, and they may put in a good word on your behalf.

EditorData.NodeContext: he's ending hte conversation here, and returning to his work. Glad to be done with us after offering this final tidbit of advice

Text.Value: Have you indeed? That's splendid.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic on second phrase

Text.Value: I'm a client of Raphael's, and had second thoughts about the terms of my deal.
This is delightful. You have what you wanted, but you cannot leave lest all hells break loose.

EditorData.NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

Text.Value: I would prostrate myself before you and kiss your calluses, but my spine is ruptured in a thousand places.

EditorData.NodeContext: extremely servile and apologetic

Text.Value: An exquisite and most unique artefact. Crafted with materials hewn from the depths of the Hells by Raphael's merregon labour force.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: Wholly deserved, of course. I spilled a glass of Baatezu Blood Wine on one of his favourite portraits.

EditorData.NodeContext: BAH-teh-zu (a kind of devil, but here used as a sort of brand name). regretful

Text.Value: I just want to explore the Archive.
Could I take a look at the Crown of Karsus?
You claimed to be who you are not, stole from my master, and now you expect to leave?

EditorData.NodeContext: irrriated

Text.Value: Of course, of course. It is highly prized due to the unique potential of the soul it is bound to.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: If the Hammer can save millions of souls, who am I to stand in your way? After all, a saved world is a fine future prospect for exploitation.

EditorData.NodeContext: first phrase is sincere, second phrase is is more sinister

Text.Value: Which world? There are so many, and so few of them are worth saving.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissive, apathetic

Text.Value: Trying to see my thoughts? There are too many - and they're all mine!

EditorData.NodeContext: unnerved, then angry

Text.Value: I might have to confiscate some of these artefacts.
Submitting the necessary paperwork will take no more than six infernal cycles, amounting to thirty-seven of your mortal years.

EditorData.NodeContext: he loves the bureaucracy; he's very aware that the person he's talking to won't.

Text.Value: As part of the special collection, that item is guarded by a masterword that even I do not know.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: Dishevelled and with a lingering odour of blood and sweat. I hope you found the boudoir to your liking.

EditorData.NodeContext: polite

Text.Value: Tsk. He can be so indulgent of his favourites.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated

Text.Value: As long as you don't remove any of the artefacts, nobody will remove your skin.

EditorData.NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

Text.Value: I just want to admire the craftsmanship.
There are few bits of me that haven't been broken already.

EditorData.NodeContext: glum

Text.Value: Stolen from Mephistopheles by gods-kissing mortals. My master certainly had nothing to do with any of that business.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

Text.Value: The master will deal with you when he returns. And I'll mop up whatever remains.

EditorData.NodeContext: not angry, just dismissive. Wants us gone

Text.Value: Not a limb out of place. Either you haven't visited the boudoir yet, or you're more robust than you look.

EditorData.NodeContext: appraising player politely, mildly surprised to see them again

Text.Value: It is where Raphael conducts his most private matters of business and pleasure. You will need this to gain access.

EditorData.NodeContext: hand-off small key-like device off-screen on final phrase. No need for object to be visible. Big emphasis on the 'and'. He's more interested in the business than the pleasure.

Text.Value: The long centuries of pain and suffering must be making me sentimental.

EditorData.NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

Text.Value: Splendid to see you again, Inquisitor.

EditorData.NodeContext: overly polite, servile

Text.Value: How about I break bits of you until you change your mind?
And, awaiting installation, we have secured a rod that gathers the Weave around it in great quantities, just as surely as shit gathers flies.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: A guest? Are you a client of the master, or a visitor from elsewhere in the Hells?

EditorData.NodeContext: Inquisitive, thoughtful, eyeing up a visitor suspiciously

Text.Value: I recommend you indulge in the pleasurable torments of the boudoir while you wait.

EditorData.NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Text.Value: I don't want to break it - Raphael said I could make some edits and clarifications to the wording.
I'm afraid you don't realise quite how much you mean to the master. He would be inconsolable if he lost that contract.

EditorData.NodeContext: faux-respectful, but really he's turning down our request

Text.Value: I don't understand the appeal of them myself, but Raphael does dote after mortals so.

EditorData.NodeContext: like a butler joking about his superior in an affectionate way - 'you know how he is'

Text.Value: All visitors arrived on schedule. Korrilla Hearthflame wished to peruse the Archive, and the Inquisitor was in a most grotesque form.

EditorData.NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

Text.Value: I do not believe you were invited. One moment - I shall consult the visitors' schedule.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated. The schedule is not a physical object - it's kept in his mind.

Text.Value: Most irregular. The schedule is all but clear. And yet you are here.

EditorData.NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

Text.Value: As it was created by Raphael himself, we have no documents of procurement, nor do we require any. But if you wish to examine the artefact itself, you are more than welcome.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
A thousand apologies, oh majestic magistrate of the infernal court! Your mortal guise is so vile, I found it perfectly convincing.

EditorData.NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

Text.Value: I'd rather you didn't. My spine has only just healed from the last time the master shattered it.

EditorData.NodeContext: glum

Text.Value: Sadly, and to my shame, my key has slipped from my pocket. You will have to penetrate the boudoir's depths using your own cunning.
Perhaps you could work off some of this aggression in the boudoir.

EditorData.NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Text.Value: As always, the Archive is yours to peruse. You'll find everything accounted for, and I can present documents of procurement if necessary.

EditorData.NodeContext: bureaucratic veneer fuly intact

Text.Value: Access the schedule by reading his thoughts.
An amulet that causes the blood to surge, and the heart to swell. Along with other parts. Most invigorating.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: Be my guest. Even if you're not scheduled for an appointment, this is a civilised place.

EditorData.NodeContext: welcoming, but with a sinister edge

Text.Value: Or have your tongue twisted so tightly you won't be able to bother me with your outrageous requests.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a sadistic smile

Text.Value: No visitors expected other than Korrilla Hearthflame and Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.

EditorData.NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

Text.Value: And of course, the Orphic Hammer itself is the prize of the collection.

EditorData.NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

Text.Value: Are there any highlights in the collection?
The resident of the boudoir will wish to explore every inch of your new form. And I'm sure you would be happy to share.
Leave.
You most certainly are not. And whoever you are, you are already trying my extremely limited patience.

EditorData.NodeContext: politely dismissive

Text.Value: Ha ha. Ahem. Most droll, Inquisitor. As you well know, the Crown of Karsus is lost.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

Text.Value: I am Karlach Demonsbane. I represent my mistress, Archduchess Zariel, and am acting as her High Inquisitor.
How about I break bits of you until you tell me how to get what I want?
Unless Master Raphael decides otherwise, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

Text.Value: You are stupendously lugubrious this day, High Inquisitor. An inspiration to us all.

EditorData.NodeContext: overly polite, servile

Text.Value: A fine pair of gauntlets that allow the wearer to twist the head from even the most resilient malingerer.

EditorData.NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Text.Value: That would be most irregular.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated

Text.Value: You may examine them, oh diabolical dominatrix, but they cannot be removed unless you present a writ of Infernal Requisition, with Article 152 correctly filled out.

EditorData.NodeContext: politely apologetic

Text.Value: Gods, I hate the Hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: Responding to something nasty said

Text.Value: Yes?

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, wants to get back to work

Text.Value: The Orphic Hammer is one of Master Raphael's most prized possessions. You can't have it. You can't even touch it. And I would suggest you don't think about it.

EditorData.NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all - politely chiding the player for asking about it on the phrases starting 'you can't have it'

Text.Value: Your presence is already an irritant more distressing than the stings of a thousand hellwasps, so I would prefer that you do leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: extremely irritated, but not losing his veneer of polite bureaucracy

Text.Value: Any new highlights in the collection?
Have you ever met Hope?
While most irregular, I shall take your preposterous request into consideration.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, having to indulge a foolish request that he thinks is beneath his station

Text.Value: Leave.
You're more than welcome to do your very worst. I'll have the guards stop you if it starts to tickle.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic

Text.Value: Take your insolent buzzing to the boudoir. You won't learn any manners there, but you might expand your imagination.

EditorData.NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Text.Value: HMMMM.

EditorData.NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Growing irritation as he can't find what he's looking for.

Text.Value: I suggest you wait until Raphael returns, and you can discuss the matter with him. You are welcome to relax in the boudoir until then.
*His eyes flicker back and forth as if he is reading a book. He has the schedule memorised... or it's carved into his eyelids.*
I'm looking for a particular contract, belonging to [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
Why not wait here until the master returns? He'll be able to verify your extraordinary claim immediately.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

Text.Value: But if you're so keen to break it, why not wait until he comes home and discuss the matter with him face-to-face?

EditorData.NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

Text.Value: Hmmm.

EditorData.NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Impatient.

Text.Value: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
You should have third, fourth, and fifth thoughts about your deal as well. You can think about all the ways you're never going to break it.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated, belittling

Text.Value: I've come for the Hammer.
Raphael won't care about losing one measly contract. Just let me have it, and I'll leave.

Synopsis:
Dialogue with Archivist in House of Hope. He is the person who keep records on all Raphael projects. Half-way between a curator and an accountant, he's incredibly repressed, and obsessed with record-keeping and accounts.

He's the model of Order and tidiness, but being from the hells, he's also hiding a dark secret. In his case, he's a masochist, and finds the concept of breaking rules thrilling, though he hates to admit it.

Strict and severe, he will try to keep order unless the player leans on his vices or fears, in which case he'll become flustered and dismiss them to the boudoir.
